io_bmp.c

00001 /*****************************************
00002  * Reads in a greyscale bitmap from file
00003  * NOTE: BMP stores image upside-down relative to other formats
00004  ****************************************/
00005 
00006 #include <stdio.h>
00007 #include <stdlib.h>
00008 
00009 #include "io_bmp.h"
00010 #include "spiceweasel.h"
00011 
00012 int read_bmp(char *filename, TRawFrame *frame)
00013 {
00014   int i, j, padding, n;
00015   BITMAPFILEHEADER        bmfh;
00016   BITMAPINFOHEADER        bmih;
00017   FILE *bitmap_file;
00018   
00019   if((bitmap_file=fopen(filename,"rb"))==NULL) {
00020     return(IO_ERROR_OPEN);
00021   } 
00022 
00023   /* Read the bitmap file header */
00024   if(fread(&bmfh,14,1,bitmap_file)!=1) {
00025     fclose(bitmap_file);
00026     return(IO_ERROR_FORMAT);
00027   }
00028 
00029   /* Read the bitmap information header */
00030   if(fread(&bmih,40,1,bitmap_file)!=1) {
00031     fclose(bitmap_file);
00032     return(IO_ERROR_FORMAT);
00033   }
00034 
00035 #ifdef DEBUG
00036   /* Print out details of bitmap */
00037   printf("\nType   : %c%c",bmfh.bfType,bmfh.bfType>>8);
00038   printf("\nSize   : %d",(int) bmfh.bfSize);
00039   printf("\nRes1   : %d",(int) bmfh.bfReserved1);
00040   printf("\nRes2   : %d",(int) bmfh.bfReserved2);
00041   printf("\nOffBits: %d\n",(int) bmfh.bfOffBits);
00042   printf("\nSize       : %d",(int) bmih.biSize);
00043   printf("\nWidth      : %d",(int) bmih.biWidth);
00044   printf("\nHeight     : %d",(int) bmih.biHeight);
00045   printf("\nPlanes     : %d",(int) bmih.biPlanes);
00046   printf("\nBitCount   : %d",(int) bmih.biBitCount);
00047   printf("\nCompression: %d",(int) bmih.biCompression);
00048   printf("\nSizeImage  : %d",(int) bmih.biSizeImage);
00049   printf("\nXPels      : %d",(int) bmih.biXPelsPerMeter);
00050   printf("\nYPels      : %d",(int) bmih.biYPelsPerMeter);
00051   printf("\nClrUsed    : %d",(int) bmih.biClrUsed);
00052   printf("\nClrImpor   : %d",(int) bmih.biClrImportant);
00053   printf("\n");
00054 #endif
00055 
00056   if(bmih.biCompression!=0) {
00057     fclose(bitmap_file);
00058     return(IO_ERROR_FORMAT);
00059   }
00060 
00061   if((bmih.biBitCount % 8) != 0) { /* Data must be in bytes */
00062     fclose(bitmap_file);
00063     return(IO_ERROR_FORMAT);
00064   }
00065 
00066   frame->bpp = bmih.biBitCount;
00067   
00068   n = frame->bpp / 8; /* Bytes per pixel */
00069 
00070   if((frame->bpp % 8) != 0) {
00071     return(IO_ERROR_FORMAT);
00072   }
00073 
00074   /* Check if the frame has been allocated */
00075   if(frame->allocated) {
00076     /* Data already allocated - check same size */
00077     if((frame->width != bmih.biWidth) || (frame->height != bmih.biHeight)) {
00078       return(IO_ERROR_SIZE);
00079     }
00080     
00081   }else {
00082     /* Allocate memory */
00083     frame->data = (unsigned char**) malloc(sizeof(char*)*bmih.biHeight);
00084     for(i=0;i!=bmih.biHeight;i++)
00085       frame->data[i] = (char*) malloc(n*sizeof(char)*bmih.biWidth);
00086     frame->width = bmih.biWidth;
00087     frame->height = bmih.biHeight;
00088     frame->allocated =  1;
00089   }
00090 
00091   /* Read n bytes per pixel */
00092   for(j=0;j!=frame->height;j++) {
00093     for(i=0;i!=frame->width;i++) {
00094       if(fread(&(frame->data[frame->height-1-j][n*i]), 
00095                1, n, bitmap_file) != n) {
00096         /* Premature end of file */
00097         fclose(bitmap_file);
00098         return(IO_ERROR_FORMAT);
00099       }
00100     }
00101     /* Scan lines always end on 32-bit boundaries */
00102     if((frame->width * n) % 4 != 0) {
00103       /* Needs extra padding */
00104       fread(&padding, 4 - ((frame->width * n) % 4), 1, bitmap_file);
00105     }
00106   }
00107 
00108   frame->channels = bmih.biPlanes;
00109 
00110   fclose(bitmap_file);
00111   return(0);
00112 }
00113 
00114 int write_bmp(char *filename, TFrame *frame)
00115 {
00116   int i, j, k, nbyte, padding;
00117   BITMAPFILEHEADER        bmfh;
00118   BITMAPINFOHEADER        bmih;
00119   FILE *bitmap_file;
00120   unsigned char pixel[3];
00121   
00122   padding = 0;
00123 
00124   if((bitmap_file=fopen(filename,"wb"))==NULL) {
00125     return(IO_ERROR_OPEN);
00126   }
00127 
00128   /* Set the bitmap file header */
00129   bmfh.bfType = 'M';
00130   bmfh.bfType = (bmfh.bfType << 8) + 'B';
00131   
00132   bmfh.bfSize = 0;
00133   bmfh.bfReserved1 = 0;
00134   bmfh.bfReserved2 = 54;
00135   bmfh.bfOffBits = 0;
00136   
00137 
00138   /* Set the information header */
00139   bmih.biSize = 40;
00140   bmih.biWidth = frame->width;
00141   bmih.biHeight = frame->height;
00142   bmih.biPlanes = 1;
00143   bmih.biBitCount = 24;
00144   bmih.biCompression = 0;
00145   bmih.biSizeImage = frame->width * frame->height * 3;
00146   bmih.biXPelsPerMeter = 0;
00147   bmih.biYPelsPerMeter = 0;
00148   bmih.biClrUsed = 0;
00149   bmih.biClrImportant = 0;
00150   
00151   /* Write the headers */
00152   if(fwrite(&bmfh, 14, 1, bitmap_file) != 1) {
00153     fclose(bitmap_file);
00154     return(IO_ERROR_WRITE);
00155   }
00156 
00157   if(fwrite(&bmih, 40, 1, bitmap_file) != 1) {
00158     fclose(bitmap_file);
00159     return(IO_ERROR_WRITE);
00160   }
00161 
00162   nbyte = 3;
00163   /* Write the data */
00164 
00165   for(j=0;j!=frame->height;j++) {
00166     for(i=0;i!=frame->width;i++) {
00167       if(frame->data[i][j] > 255.5)
00168         frame->data[i][j] = 255.5;
00169       pixel[0] = (unsigned char) frame->data[i][frame->height-1-j];
00170       for(k=1;k<nbyte;k++)
00171         pixel[k] = pixel[0];
00172       
00173       if(fwrite(pixel, 1, nbyte, bitmap_file) != nbyte) {
00174         fclose(bitmap_file);
00175         return(IO_ERROR_WRITE);
00176       }
00177     }
00178     /* Scan lines always end on 32-bit boundaries */
00179     if((frame->width * nbyte) % 4 != 0) {
00180       /* Needs extra padding */
00181       fwrite(&padding, 4 - ((frame->width * nbyte) % 4), 1, bitmap_file);
00182     }
00183   }
00184   fclose(bitmap_file);
00185   fflush(stdout);
00186 
00187   return(0);
00188 }
